repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Education
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial, achieved through
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and Borrower.
            Lessons are conveyed as follows. The experience from the
            successful implementation of the Quality Fund mechanisms,
            which made resources available directly to the
            beneficiaries, was used for the preparation of one of the
            components in the new Education Restructuring Project. These
            developed mechanisms made it possible to decentralize
            procurement of goods, and services among schools in the
            country's fragmented structure, which resulted to a
            certain extent, in the empowerment of schools, and,
            increased engagement in the reform process. Notwithstanding,
            the Project implementation process however, demonstrates a
            need for further attention to the dialogue with the 10
            cantonal ministries of education within Bosnia and
            Herzegovina Federation. These cantonal ministries need to be
            fully engaged in the dialogue, and endorse the project
            objectives, to ensure that they provide full support to
            their implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Education
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Development Project, will
            improve teaching, and learning processes in Bosnia and
            Herzegovina, therefore improve the quality of primary
            education, and will promote equitable use, and coordination
            of public resources to build a professional basis for the
            education system. The components will: 1) establish a
            Quality Fund to finance school grants, teacher training
            grants, and scholarships, and grants to support
            institutional strengthening of those institutions offering
            pre-service, and in-service teacher training; 2) develop a
            standards and assessment agency, to define performance
            standards, and assess those standards, through data
            processing on learning levels at primary, and secondary
            schools in the country, and promote compatibility with the
            rest of Europe; 3) finance the development of an education
            management information system, to enable improved
            management, and compatibility of information sector wise,
            among the county's decentralized education systems. It
            will further test the viability for a budgeting model,
            designed to promote increased efficiency in education
            spending; 3) stimulate coordination, innovation, and
            strategic planning for higher education, through the
            provision of technical assistance, and training to academics
            in the country; and, 4) provide reliable data for creating a
            Poverty Reduction Strategy, and carry out a Living Standards
            Measurement Study.
